results.title: Dersu Uzala
results.brief_description: A fascinating epic by veteran Japanese director, Kurosawa, about the struggle of hardy souls to chart the wilderness of Siberia around 1900. Remarkable photography and the performance of Munzuk as an old native hunter carry the film. Drawn from the autobiographical novels of a military explorer.

results.title: The Secret garden
results.creator_credit: Fred M Wilcox, Clarence Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A delightful dramatisation based on the well-known children’s book of the same name. A young girl comes to live in a run down Victorian estate and finds an abandoned garden which she cares for. She befriends the young crippled son of the house - with amazing results. Stars Margaret O’Brien and Dean Stockwell. Rated: G

results.title: The Importance of keeping perfectly still
results.creator_credit: Michael Pattinson, Mark Ruse, Kookaburra Productions and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Concerns a young man apprenticed to a high society photographer at the turn of the 19th century. When his boss receives a vice regal appointment to photograph the Governor’s family, he cannot handle the strain of this and a love affair at the same time. His girlfriend insists that she must have a ‘sign’ from heaven before a marriage can take place. Cast includes Liddy Clark, Frederick Parslow, Peter Sardi, Frank Thring, Frank Wilson.

results.title: Just Australian trains
results.brief_description: A compilation of seven films featuring the trains of Australia - from our past to present day. This will appeal to the railway enthusiasts, and to those who aren’t railway buffs it may explain some of the railway’s history and mystique.

results.title: Adelaide celebrations
results.creator_credit: Penny Chapman, Terry Jennings, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the many theatre arts and crafts on display at Adelaide Festival time. An interesting study of Adelaide at the time of its biennial festival of the arts, in 1976.

results.title: Winners : Just friends
results.creator_credit: Michael Pattinson, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Winners Series”.
Susan has just moved to a new part of town. It’s school holidays and she goes to practice her skills at the local roller rink. Buzz, the Prince of the rink, spots the talented newcomer and moves in on her. Susan joins Buzz and his gang - but she doesn’t know what she is letting herself in for. Rated: G

results.title: Activity sampling: a training film
results.creator_credit: David Stevens and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the technique by simulating a real-life office situation. It aims at giving students practice in distinguishing between the various activities observed and calculating results from their observations.

results.title: Ann: A World of her own (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roland Joffe, Steve Morrison and Granada Television International

results.title: Queenscliff beaches; Our journey
results.creator_credit: Paul Jones and Queenscliff Primary School
results.brief_description:
This film is a learning outcome from the “Beaches” group student led investigation program at Queenscliff Primary School. It was undertaken as part of the 2007 Snapshots of Remote Communities Project and was overall winner of the Annual Sprockets and Flares Multimedia Awards.
A combination of softwares including Blue Sky technologies and artwork by the students was used in the creation of this work.
Two versions are included:
1. Queenscliff beaches - final product
2. Our journey - details the behind-the-scenes and process
